main.name: Jacqueline Moore
main.description: a writer, a photographer, and a climber.
main.bio: I plan to graduate from UC Davis in September of 2021 with a double major in biomedical engineering (B.S.) and English (B.A.). I'm interested in applying my technical writing experience and my engineering background to expand my writing and project management skills.
main.listIntro: But there's more to me than my resume. You might be interested to know that:
bioList: My favorite podcast is called 'No Such Thing As A Fish.'
One of my personal goals is to complete a wintertime summit of Mount Shasta.
Another goal is to run a marathon.
If I had to choose my favorite book, I'd pick Ian McEwan's 'Atonement.'
My least favorite book is 'The Catcher in the Rye.' Change my mind!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: Specialization in Literature, Criticism, and Theory

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Informed product direction in collaboration with research, UX, and product teams to validate new product strategies and designs.

work.company: InnovationAccess, UC Davis Office of Research
work.title: Technology Transfer Intern
work.description: Conducted prior art searches for prospective patent applications. Composed freedom to operate analyses and non-confidential descriptions.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Authored the script for a user help video about a beta feature of Einstein Analytics. Updated technical docs about SAQL tools for developers using Oxygen and Perforce. Drafted a release note about an update to the Einstein Analytics data filtering tool.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Drove the creation of an interactive module for a user-facing, instructional applet that explains how to implement data analysis tools of Einstein Analytics. Collaborated cross-team with technical writers, product managers, and developers to design and build the user interface.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Composed user manuals directed at developers that describe how to implement new product features. Partnered with engineering interns to incorporate high-level use cases into product documentation.

activities.title: Project Manager, Microfluidics
activities.description: Co-led a 10-person research team in constructing two cost-efficient microfluidic controllers for RNA sequencing. Also collaborated with teammates to design and build microfluidic chips using AutoCAD and UV exposure systems (for low-cost photolithography).

activities.title: Vice President of Outreach and Content Strategy
activities.description: Designed and built the organization's website using Figma and Squarespace. Spearheaded the creation and release of monthly newsletters using HTML and CSS that are digitally distributed to >500 UC Davis students and faculty.

activities.title: Copy Editor
activities.description: Proofread copy — roughly 25 articles per week — using The Aggie's variation of the AP Style Guide. Previously served the paper as a campus news reporter, which involved composing one article per week and conducting relevant, in-person interviews.

writing.title: A video script that explains how to implement features of the new Einstein Analytics dataset editor.
A developer manual that demonstrates how to apply remote.it's bulk scripting tool.
A sample from a technical essay that I wrote about deep learning. I adapted it for a non-technical audience.
A news article that I wrote for The Stanford Daily as a reporting intern. This sparked my interest in biomedical science.
A news article that I authored for The California Aggie.
A feature story that I composed for The California Aggie.

projectmgmt.title: Inexpensive Microfluidic Controller for RNA Sequencing
Prep Your Data with the Transform Node

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
